isis.stitle: TSI 06-12-02 - Barry Style Rear Engine Mounts Available for 5000i Models Built After January 1, 2000 with Caterpillar or Cummins Engines

subjectgroup.subject: Barry Style Rear Engine Mounts Available for 5000i Models Built After January 1, 2000 with Caterpillar or Cummins Engines

geninfo.para: International has released for service Barry (vee) style rear engine mounts to replace Lord (pad) style mounts. The kits are a direct replacement, without modification, for Caterpillar and Cummins engines and will provide increased service life of the engine rear mount isolators.

entry.para: Cummins Rear Engine Mount Kit:1664755C3, Rear Engine Bracket (2)1664729C4, Isolator (2)2589968C1, Rear Frame Bracket, Left (1)2589969C1, Rear Frame Bracket, Right (1)

Caterpillar Rear Engine Mount Kit:1667461C91, Rear Engine Bracket, Left (1)1667462C91, Rear Engine Bracket, Right (1)1664729C4, Isolator (2)2589970C1, Rear Frame Bracket, Left (1)2589971C1, Rear Frame Bracket, Right (1)

svcproc.title: Service procedure

warning.para: To avoid property damage, personal injury, or death, park the vehicle on a flat level surface, set the parking brake, turn the engine off, and chock the wheels.

step1.para: Remove the through bolt that ties the engine bracket, isolator, and frame bracket together on each side of the engine.

warning.para: To avoid personal injury or death a jack must never be used alone to support the engine. Support the engine with floor stands.

step1.para: Raise the engine enough to remove engine weight from the rear mounting brackets then support the engine with floor stands.
Remove the existing isolator, engine bracket, and frame bracket on each side of the engine.

svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 1 for the following Steps.

step1.para: Install the new frame brackets (see Note) from the kit with 1/2 - 20 bolts and nuts. Tighten to 110 to 120 Lbf-ft (149 to 163 Nm). NOTE: Caterpillar and Cummins engines use a designated right (passenger) and left (driver) side frame bracket.

Install the new engine brackets (see note) from the kit with 3/4-16 bolts. Tighten to 260 to 290 Lbf-ft (353 to 393 Nm). NOTE: Caterpillar engines use a designated right (passenger) and left (driver) side engine bracket.
Install the "vee" isolator to the frame bracket with 3/8-16 bolts. Tighten to 34 to 38 Lbf-ft (46 to 52 Nm).
Lower the engine to seat the rear mounts and install a 3/4-16 through bolt and nut. Tighten to 330 to 370 Lbf-ft (447 to 502 Nm).
